clinical_study.brief_title: Brain Mechanisms of Reducing Polysubstance Use Following a Novel Body-mind Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Brain Mechanisms of Reducing Polysubstance Use Following a Novel Body-mind Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed study will examine brain mechanisms of a brief mindfulness intervention - IBMT on ATC reduction.

detailed_description.textblock: The R61 phase of the proposed study will examine brain mechanisms of a brief mindfulness intervention - IBMT that targets at self-control networks in the brain, and test IBMT effects on ATC reduction.

primary_outcome.measure: Brain changes of IBMT on polysubstance use
primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome measures are assessed at baseline, 2-4 weeks and 3 months
primary_outcome.description: 70 participants with polysubstance use are assessed by changes of behavior (NIH PhenX Toolkit, RDoC matrix) and brain (fMRI) before (baseline) and after interventions (2-4 Weeks) and 3 months of follow-ups.

intervention.description: mindful presence in a non-judgmental way
